page.title: 11BISHOP BURTON PUBLIC HOUSE
page.content: It is named after a famous local {horse, Altisidora.}Overall, custom is made up of{10% locals, 90% visitors, proportions differing according to the day of the week ( Friday being mostly locals). The pub is affected by the Agricultural College, especially during the first term of the year. Busiest times are at the weekend and during school holidays. There has been a general increase in the sale of pub food and has a designated area to cater for it. Also there has been a switch in preference from beer to lager. It attracts much passing trade, being situated on the main York - Hull road and is said to be the most photographed pub in Britain. Public opinion indicates opening hours should become more flexible, with short hours at the beginning of the week and longer hours at the weekend.
